moves.1. e4 d5: I'm still experimenting with the scandinavian and its mostly working well for me
moves.2. exd5 Qxd5 3. d4: This was rather unexpected as it puts no pressure on my queen, I was expecting Nc3
moves.3... Nc6: This was to attack the pawn but I think now that I should have played Nf6 in preference
moves.6. Bd2 Be6 7. Nf3 exd4 8. cxd4 Bb4 9. Nc: An early attack from white but I am not sure it accomplishes much, I would be more concerned with getting my king safe.
moves.14. Nb5 Bxd2+ 15. Rxd2: I don't like this move from white, not that there was a lot better that I can see, it allows Re1+
moves.16... Nb4+ 17. Kb3: This is probably the best of the options as Kc3 loses to Nd5+,  Qxd5 (forced due to threat of Kb3 Qxa2#)  Nxd5 and white is lost
moves.17... Qxa2+ 18. Kxb4: Again probably the better option due to Kc3, Ne4+, Kb3, Nxd2+ forking the queen
